DOC.criteria: History allergic conjunctivitis ragweed least one year Positive skin prick test ragweed pollen within 12 month prior visit 1 BCVA leat 20/400 Structural lid abnormality ( ectropion , entropion ) Active lid disease ( ie moderate severe blepharitis , meibomianitis ) require medical treatment Presence follicular conjunctivitis , anterior uveitis preauricular lymphadenopathy History ophthalmic abnormality , include history dry eye Perennial allergic rhinoconjunctivitis significant allergy animal dander avoid study period History chronic bacterial viral ocular infection , herpes keratitis , and/or presence active bacterial viral ocular infection presence mucous discharge , excess lacrimation burning symptom ocular disease Currently chronic ocular topical medication Use topical systemic ocular medication study period History complication , adverse event , trauma disease nasolacrimal area History symptomatic epiphoria
